JSR 309 TCK documentation

These testcases explore the various functionalities of the JSR 309 specification.

See:

These testcases explore the various functionalities of the JSR 309 specification.
See the JSR 309 TCK User Guide for installation and run: TCKUserGuide.html
For test coverage, see the summary table of all testcases: TCKSummary.html.
The goal is to verify the media features exposed through the API.

Test framework

The testcases are JUnit 3 based.
Logging is using apache log4j.

Packages structure

The java packages reflect the mandatory/optional split explained in the TCK User Guide.
This package contains framework and utility classes, that serve as a base for all testcases.

Testcases numbering

Numbering goes through the package/classes tree. When possible, branches are numbered before leaves:
root package testcases (com.hp.opencall.jmsc.test): 1
mandatory 2
mandatory.functional 2_1
mandatory.functional.PlayerTest 2_1_1
mandatory.functional.PlayerTest.test_2_1_1_1_Play
mandatory.functional.RecorderTest 2_1_2
etc...
mandatory.robustness 2_2
optional 3
optional.functional 3_1
optional.functional.DtmfGrammarTest 3_1_1
...
optional.functional.video 3_1_6
optional.functional.vxml 3_1_7

As a result, all mandatory functional testcases have numbers starting with "2_1"
